question:
Read the given statement and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statement.

Statement:

Cyclone Sepa is expected to make landfall by 3 p.m. today on the Balasore coast. Rough seas, heavy rain and strong winds are expected to lash Balasore from 11 a.m. onwards. Power supply in Balasore is likely to be affected from 2 p.m. to 9 p.m.

Conclusions:

I. There could be power cuts in Balasore after 3 p.m. today.

II. It would be unsafe for fishermen to venture out into the sea today, till the cyclone passes.

Group - D 18/08/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only conclusion I follows
option_2: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_3: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_4: Only conclusion II follows
solution:
Conclusion I:“There could be power cuts in Balasore after 3 p.m. today.”✔ The statement clearly mentions that power supply is likely to be affected from 2 p.m. to 9 p.m., so power cuts after 3 p.m. are highly probable. Thus, Conclusion I logically follows.

Conclusion II:“It would be unsafe for fishermen to venture out into the sea today, till the cyclone passes.”✔ The statement says rough seas, heavy rain, and strong winds will lash Balasore from 11 a.m. onwards, due to Cyclone Sepa. These conditions are dangerous, especially for fishermen. So, this conclusion also follows logically based on the expected weather conditions.

Both conclusions are direct and reasonable interpretations of the given statement.

question:
Read the given statement and conclusions carefully. Decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statement.

Statement:

R is not the mother of P. P is the daughter of S, and S has three daughters.

Conclusions:

I. P is the sister of R.

II. S is the mother of P.

NTPC CBT II Level 6 (09/05/2022) Shift 2
option_1: Only conclusion I follows
option_2: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_3: Only conclusion II follows
option_4: Both conclusions I and II follow
solution:
The statement says that R is not the mother of P. It also states that P is the daughter of S and that S has three daughters. However, nothing confirms whether S is male or female, so we cannot be sure that S is the mother of P—S could also be the father. Hence, Conclusion II does not logically follow.

Additionally, while R is not P’s mother, no information is provided about R’s relationship to S or to P. So we cannot assume that R is P’s sister. Therefore, Conclusion I also does not follow.

Final Answer: Neither conclusion I nor II follows

question:
Consider the given statement and decide which of the given assumptions is/are implicit in the statement.

Statement by an environmentalist:

“High percentage of carbon dioxide in the environment creates a high degree of the greenhouse effect.”

Conclusions:

There should be minimum carbon dioxide in the environment.

2. Minimum greenhouse effect should be maintained.

NTPC CBT - I 09/03/2021 (Morning)
option_1: Only assumption (1) is implicit
option_2: Neither assumption (1) nor (2) is implicit
option_3: Both assumptions (1) and (2) are implicit
option_4: Only assumption (2) is implicit
solution:
Assumption 1:

"There should be minimum carbon dioxide in the environment."

  • The statement doesn't suggest what should be done.
  • It only says that high CO₂ leads to stronger greenhouse effect.
  • So, this assumption goes beyond what is stated.

Assumption 2:

"Minimum greenhouse effect should be maintained."

  • Again, the statement doesn’t express any desire to reduce the greenhouse effect.
  • It’s just an explanation of cause and effect.
  • So this is also not directly implied.

Final Answer: (b) Neither assumption (1) nor (2) is implicit.

question:
In this question, a statement is given followed by two conclusions. Choose the conclusion(s) which best fit(s) logically.

Statement:

Domestic demand has been increasing faster than the production of indigenous crude oil.

Conclusions:

I. Crude oil must be imported if the demand has to be met.

II. Domestic demand should be reduced

RRB JE 24/05/2019 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only conclusion II follows
option_2: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_3: Either conclusion I or II follows
option_4: Only conclusion I follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

"Crude oil must be imported if the demand has to be met."

This logically follows.

If demand is greater than domestic production, the only way to meet the excess demand is to import crude oil.

Conclusion II:

"Domestic demand should be reduced."

This is a suggestion or value judgment, not a logical conclusion based on the statement.

The statement does not imply that reducing demand is the intended or required solution—it only states the current situation.

Final Answer: (d) Only conclusion I follows

question:
In this question, a statement is given followed by two conclusions. Choose the conclusion(s) which best fit(s) logically.

Statement:

This world is neither good nor evil; each man manufactures a world for himself.

Conclusions:

I. Some people find this world good.

II. Some people find this world bad.

RRB JE 24/05/2019 (Evening)
option_1: Only conclusion II follows
option_2: Only conclusion I follows
option_3: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_4: Either conclusion I nor II follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

"Some people find this world good."

This follows.

If everyone creates their own version of the world, then some people will see it as good.

Conclusion II:

"Some people find this world bad."

This also follows.

Similarly, others may view the world as bad, depending on their own perception.

Final Answer: (c) Both conclusions I and II follow

question:
Given below is a statement followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. You have to consider the statements taking them to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. Then consider both the conclusions together and decide which of them logically follows from the information given in the statements.

Statement: A research found that if high school students get eight hours of sleep instead of 6 hours before an exam, their scores increase by 20%.

conclusion

I: If the student wants to score better marks, then eight hours of sleep is better than six hours of sleep.

conclusion

II: The students are stressed because all the exams are difficult.

ALP Tier II 21/01/2019 (Morning)
option_1: Neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follow.
option_2: Only Conclusion I obey.
option_3: Conclusion I and conclusion II both follow.
option_4: Only conclusion II obeys.
solution:
Conclusion I:

"If the student wants to score better marks, then eight hours of sleep is better than six hours of sleep."

This conclusion is directly supported by the statement.

It logically follows from the research finding.

Conclusion II:

"The students are stressed because all the exams are difficult."

This is an assumption not mentioned in the statement.

  • There is no mention of stress or difficulty level of exams in the given data.
  • So, this does not logically follow.

Final Answer: (b) Only Conclusion I follows

question:
In this question, a statement is given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true, then consider the two conclusions together and decide which of them logically follows beyond a reasonable doubt from the information given in the statement.

Statement:

Sachin scored a total of 200 in 2 matches.

Conclusion:

i) Sachin hit 2 centuries

ii) Sachin hit 4 half centuries Choose the appropriate one from the

following options

(A) Only conclusion I follows

(B) Only conclusion II follows

(C) Either I or II follows

(D) Neither I nor II follows

(E) Both I and II follow.

RPF Constable 18/01/2019 (Morning)
option_1: D
option_2: B
option_3: A
option_4: C
solution:
Conclusion I:

Sachin hit 2 centuries.

This means he scored 100 runs in each match.

This is possible, but not necessarily true.

He could have scored 150 in one and 50 in another.

So this does not logically follow.

Conclusion II:

Sachin hit 4 half-centuries.

This implies he scored 50+ runs in 4 innings.

But the statement clearly says he played only 2 matches, so 4 half-centuries is not possible.

This is factually incorrect.

Final Answer: (a) D — Neither I nor II follows

question:
In this question, a statement and related two conclusions have been given in the form of i and ii, assuming that the statements given in the statements to be true are to be sure that what conclusions regarding the statements are logical?

Statement: It rains every Monday, it is raining today.

Conclusion:

(i) It is the rainy season.

(ii) Today is Monday.

Choose the right one from the following options .

(A) only conclusion i is rational.

(B) only conclusion ii is rational.

(C) either i or ii conclusion is rational.

(D) neither i nor ii conclusion is rational.

(E) i and ii both conclusions are rational.

RPF S.I. 10/01/2019 (Morning)
option_1: B
option_2: D
option_3: C
option_4: A
solution:
(i) It is the rainy season.

Not necessarily true.

Just because it's raining today doesn't mean it's the rainy season.

The statement says nothing about the season.

So, this conclusion does not follow.

(ii) Today is Monday.

Again, not necessarily true.

The statement says "It rains every Monday", but not that it rains only on Mondays.

So rain can occur on other days too.

Example: It can be Wednesday and still rain.

Hence, we cannot conclude that today is Monday just because it's raining.

Final Answer: (b) D — Neither I nor II conclusion is rational

question:
Read the given statement and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statement.

Statement:

Team A students lost 14 out of 20 games they played last season.

Conclusions:

I. Team A students are more interested in academics than sports.

II. Team A students are unlucky.

Group - D 22/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_2: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_3: Only conclusion II follows
option_4: Only conclusion I follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

Team A students are more interested in academics than sports.

This is an assumption, not a logical conclusion.

The statement gives no information about their academic interest, only their performance in games.

So, Conclusion I does not follow.

Conclusion II:

Team A students are unlucky.

This is a value judgment and a subjective interpretation.

Poor performance does not necessarily mean bad luck. It could be due to skill, preparation, or strong opponents.

The statement does not mention luck at all.

So, Conclusion II does not follow.

Final Answer: (b) Neither conclusion I nor II follows

question:
Read the given statement and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statement.

Statement:

In a recent survey on choice of drink, 65 percent of the people preferred tea, 28 percent preferred coffee, 5 percent preferred milk, while 2 percent were neutral.

Conclusions:

I. Tea is a better drink than coffee.

II. More people prefer to drink coffee as compared to milk

Group - D 23/08/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only conclusion II follows
option_2: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_3: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_4: Only conclusion I follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

Tea is a better drink than coffee.

This is a subjective opinion, not a logical conclusion.

The statement gives preference percentages, not quality comparisons.

So, we cannot conclude tea is better than coffee — only that more people prefer tea.

Conclusion I does not follow.

Conclusion II:

More people prefer to drink coffee as compared to milk.

Yes — 28% prefer coffee and 5% prefer milk.

This is a direct comparison from the given data.

Conclusion II follows.

Final Answer: (a) Only conclusion II follows

question:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Assuming the given statements to be true, consider the given statements and state which of the conclusions logically follows from the statements?

Statement:

Due to the shortage of onions and large scale hoarding by some traders, onion prices have increased significantly.

Conclusion:

I. The government should take strict legal action against hoarders, and hoarders should be punished harshly.

II. People should stop eating onions, and should eat potatoes instead.

Group - D 23/08/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows.
option_2: Only Conclusion I follows.
option_3: Both conclusions I and II follow.
option_4: Only conclusion II follows.
solution:
Conclusion I:

The government should take strict legal action against hoarders, and hoarders should be punished harshly.

This is a logical course of action suggested based on the reason (hoarding) given in the statement. Since hoarding is clearly linked to the price rise, taking action against hoarders is a relevant and logical conclusion.

Conclusion II:

People should stop eating onions and eat potatoes instead.

This is an illogical or extreme suggestion. The statement talks about the cause of price rise, not about what people should eat. Replacing onions with potatoes is not a necessary or logical outcome based on the information provided.

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible conclusions I and II. Read all the information given in the statement carefully and decide which of the given conclusions can be concluded from the given information.

Statement: An online teaching platform has reported to earn almost double through subscriptions ever since they started LIVE problem-solving classes on the platform.

Conclusions:

I. No other online teaching platform offers LIVE problem-solving classes.

II. Students who opt for LIVE problem-solving sessions on the said platform have to pay double the fees as compared to those who opt for regular classes.

Group - D 25/08/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Both I and II can be concluded
option_2: Only II can be concluded
option_3: Only I can be concluded
option_4: Neither I nor II can be concluded
solution:
Conclusion I:

No other online teaching platform offers LIVE problem-solving classes.

This cannot be concluded from the given statement. The statement only talks about one platform and its earnings; it does not mention anything about other platforms. So, we can't assume what other platforms offer.

Conclusion II:

Students who opt for LIVE problem-solving sessions on the said platform have to pay double the fees as compared to those who opt for regular classes.

The statement says the platform earned double overall after introducing LIVE sessions. But it does not specify whether the fees per student increased, or more students subscribed, or both. So, we cannot conclude that fees doubled.

Neither conclusion is supported directly by the statement.

question:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully and decide which of the given conclusions logically follows (s) from the statements.

Statements:

In a race.

G is behind L who is behind D.

2. D is ahead of G who is ahead of R.

3. F is not behind V who is ahead of R.

Conclusions:

I. V is behind D.

II. F is ahead of R

III. D is ahead of R.

Group - D 05/09/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Conclusion III follows
option_2: Conclusions II and III follow
option_3: Conclusions I and III follow
option_4: Conclusions I and II follow
solution:
Conclusion I: V is behind D

We know:

  • V > R
  • D > G > R

    But we do not know the relative position between V and D, so we cannot conclude this.

    Conclusion I does not follow

Conclusion II: F is ahead of R

From statement 3:

F ≥ V > R ⇒ So, F > R or F = V > R

Clearly, F is ahead of R

Conclusion II follows

Conclusion III: D is ahead of R

From statement 2:

D > G > R

So, D is ahead of R

Conclusion III follows

Conclusions II and III follow.

question:
A statement is given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) beyond a reasonable doubt from the information given in the statement.

Statement:

It is reported that heavy and erratic rainfall has destroyed many agricultural crops and farmers are in debt.

Conclusions:

I. Farmers need not repay the debt.

II. Prices of groceries and other essential food items such as lentils and grains will surge.

Group - D 19/09/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_2: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_3: Only conclusion I follows
option_4: Only conclusion II follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

Farmers need not repay the debt.

This is an assumption or opinion, not a logical conclusion from the statement. The statement only reports that farmers are in debt due to crop destruction — it does not suggest anything about waiving or not repaying the debt. So this does not logically follow.

Conclusion II:

Prices of groceries and other essential food items such as lentils and grains will surge.

If crops are destroyed due to rainfall, this could lead to a shortage in supply, which commonly results in price rise of essential food items. This is a logical consequence of the information given and thus follows beyond reasonable doubt.

(d) Only conclusion II follows

question:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully and decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.

Statements:

R is older than I.

2. I is N's twin brother who is older than P.

3. Y is not younger than R who is older than K.

Conclusions:

I. K is older than I.

II. I is younger than Y.

Group - D 20/09/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Conclusion II follows
option_2: Both conclusions I and II follow
option_3: Conclusion I follows
option_4: Neither conclusions I nor II follows
solution:
Conclusion I: K is older than I

From the statements:

  • R > I
  • R > K

But we don’t know the relation between I and K directly. K might be younger or older than I, but we cannot conclude for sure.

Conclusion I does not follow

Conclusion II: I is younger than Y

From the chain:

  • Y ≥ R > I

    ⇒ So Y is either older than or equal to R, and since R is older than I,

    we get Y > I or Y = R > I

So I is definitely younger than Y.

Conclusion II follows

Final Answer: (a) Conclusion II follows

question:
A statement is given followed by two conclusions () and (). Consider the information given in the statement to be true even if it seems to be at variance from commonly known facts and state which of the given conclusions, if any, logically follow from the given statement.

Statement:

Sagar used wet hands to switch off the electric lights in his house, due to which he got shocked.

Conclusion:

I. All the electrical wires in the house need to be replaced.

II. Never touch any electrical equipment with wet hands.

Group - D 22/09/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only conclusion only I follows
option_2: Both conclusion I and II follow
option_3: Only conclusion II follows
option_4: Neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

All the electrical wires in the house need to be replaced.

This conclusion does not logically follow from the statement. There is no mention of faulty or damaged wires in the statement. The shock occurred due to Sagar using wet hands, not because of bad wiring. So, replacing the wires is not logically justified based on the given information.

Conclusion II:

Never touch any electrical equipment with wet hands.

This conclusion logically follows. The statement presents a cause-effect situation: Sagar touched the switch with wet hands → got shocked. This clearly supports a general safety principle: do not use electrical equipment with wet hands.

Final Answer: Only conclusion II follows

question:
A statement is given followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) beyond a reasonable doubt from the information given in the statement.

Statement:

Sale up to 70% on all clothing items in the store and online.

Conclusions:

I. All clothing items are 70% off during the sale period.

II. There are some clothing items that are not on sale.

Group - D 22/09/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_2: Only conclusion II follows
option_3: Only conclusion I follows
option_4: Both conclusions I and II follow
solution:
Conclusion I:

All clothing items are 70% off during the sale period.

Incorrect. The phrase "up to 70%" means that the discount can be any amount from 0% to 70%. So, it's not true that all items are 70% off.

Conclusion II:

There are some clothing items that are not on sale.

The statement says "sale on all clothing items", which implies every clothing item has some discount, even if it's less than 70%.

So, it’s not correct to conclude that some items are not on sale at all.

Final Conclusion: Neither I nor II is logically guaranteed by the statement.

question:
In this question, a statement is followed by two conclusions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and decide which of them logically follow(s) beyond a reasonable doubt from the information given in the statement.

Statement:

Before leaving for college, Sita is learning to cook basic meals from her mother.

Conclusions:

I. Sita didn't know how to cook.

II. Sita wants to throw a party for her friends before leaving for college.

Group - D 26/09/2022 (Afternoon)
option_1: Only conclusion II follows
option_2: Neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_3: Only conclusion I follows
option_4: Both conclusions I and II follow
solution:
Conclusion I:

Sita didn't know how to cook.

This logically follows. Since the statement clearly says Sita is learning to cook basic meals, it implies she didn’t know how to cook before, or at least not the basics.

Conclusion II:

Sita wants to throw a party for her friends before leaving for college.

There is no mention in the statement about any party, friends, or any related intention. This is a speculation, not a conclusion based on the given information.

Final Answer: (c) Only conclusion I follows

question:
A statement is given followed by two possible conclusions numbered I and II. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true and on the basis of it, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s).

Statement:

"I want to start my own business of exporting cashews and hazelnuts to Turkey and America because I have many friends in these countries with similar business interests, which I think will be helpful." A told B. −

Conclusions:

I. It's always beneficial to have good contacts in the domains of work.

II. B is not interested in doing business with A.

Group - D 26/09/2022 (Evening)
option_1: Neither conclusion follows
option_2: Both the conclusions follow
option_3: Only conclusion I follows
option_4: Only conclusion II follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

"It's always beneficial to have good contacts in the domains of work."

This logically follows from the statement.

A clearly mentions that he wants to start the business because he has many friends with similar business interests — implying that good contacts are helpful. So, this is a valid generalization that logically follows.

Conclusion II:

"B is not interested in doing business with A."

There is no information in the statement about B’s interest or disinterest in the business. The statement is just A expressing an idea to B — we cannot infer B’s thoughts or intent from that.

Final Answer: (c) Only conclusion I follows

question:
Read the given statement and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, even if it appears to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statement.

Statement:

Prices of pulses have doubled in the last 15 days due to shortages artificially created by large-scale hoarding by a few traders.

Conclusions:

I. Hoarding is the only factor that leads to an increase in the price of pulses

II. Fifteen days ago, there was no shortage in availability of pulses

Group - D 27/09/2022 (Morning)
option_1: Only conclusion II follows
option_2: neither conclusion I nor II follows
option_3: both conclusions I and II follow
option_4: Only conclusion I follows
solution:
Conclusion I:

"Hoarding is the only factor that leads to an increase in the price of pulses."

  • This is not logically valid.

    The statement mentions that this specific price rise happened due to hoarding, but it doesn't say hoarding is the only cause for price increases in general.

    There could be other reasons (e.g., crop failure, transportation issues, demand rise) not mentioned here.

Conclusion II:

"Fifteen days ago, there was no shortage in availability of pulses."

  • This also doesn't logically follow.

    The statement says a shortage was created due to hoarding, but it doesn't explicitly say there was no shortage before.

    Maybe there was already some shortage, and hoarding worsened it.

Correct Answer: (b) Neither conclusion I nor II follows.
